entries.title: Zelensky Expected to Visit Washington on Wednesday
entries.description: The trip would be the Ukrainian President’s first visit outside his country since Russia invaded in February.

entries.title: Taliban Ban Women From Universities
entries.description: A new decree has broadened a ban on female education that has drawn international condemnation and isolated Afghanistan’s hardline government.

entries.title: Mexico Grants Asylum to Family of Peru's Jailed Former President
entries.description: Relatives of Pedro Castillo enter Mexico’s Embassy after more than two dozen die in protests.

entries.title: China's Factories Face Life Without 'Zero Covid'
entries.description: An abrupt end to harsh pandemic rules has left factories and businesses with little insulation from fast-spreading infections.

entries.title: Putin Describes Situation in Occupied Ukrainian Territories as 'Extremely Difficult'
entries.description: The Russian president made a rare admission that the war in Ukraine is facing obstacles.

entries.title: Cubans Spend Thousands to Flee to the U.S. Through Nicaragua
entries.description: Flights bring Cubans to the Central American nation, from where they head for the U.S. border.

entries.title: Ukraine's Zelensky Visits Front-Line City of Bakhmut
entries.description: Volodymyr Zelensky made an unannounced visit to the front-line city of Bakhmut on Tuesday, rallying troops on the country’s deadliest battlefield as Russia intensifies efforts to seize it.

entries.title: Japan Bends to Global Forces Pushing Up Rates
entries.description: Bank of Japan Gov. Haruhiko Kuroda gave markets one more surprise in the form of an interest-rate increase that he said wasn’t really an increase.

entries.title: Former Nazi Camp Secretary, 97, Found Guilty in What Could be Final Holocaust Trial
entries.description: A German court handed a 97-year-old woman a suspended two-year prison sentence for her role at a concentration camp in World War II.

entries.title: Japan's Weapons Buildup to Bolster Efforts to Counter China
entries.description: Tokyo’s plans to increase military spending herald a new phase of military competition in Asia.

entries.title: Ciudad Juárez Becomes Hot Spot in Latest Migration Surge
entries.description: Anticipating a change in U.S. immigration policy, migrants have been rushing to cross into Texas.

entries.title: Kim Yo Jong Blasts Skeptics of North Korea's Military Advances
entries.description: The sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un threatened to further escalate tensions with long-range missile tests.
